title: President George Washington's Birthday, 2026
summary: This proclamation honors President George Washington on his birthday, February 16, 2026, coinciding with the 250th anniversary of American independence. It highlights Washington's pivotal role in the American Revolution, his leadership in establishing the Continental Army, and his resilience during challenging times like Trenton and Valley Forge. The text emphasizes his commitment to law, liberty, and the common good, as well as his role in presiding over the Constitutional Convention and serving as the first President. A key legacy mentioned is Washington's belief in the importance of faith and virtue for a strong nation. The proclamation declares February 16, 2026, a reserved holiday to commemorate his birthday and legacy.
